item.title: From planning to kill family to having dreams about Isis: New Orleans attack suspect's videos expose dark - The Times of India
item.description:
From planning to kill family to having dreams about Isis: New Orleans attack suspect's videos expose dark plans

Publication Date: [Date not provided] Source: [Source not provided]

Videos from the New Orleans attack suspect reveal unsettling intentions including thoughts of violence and extremist ideologies.

  • Suspect was planning an attack on his family.
  • Had dreams about involvement with ISIS.
  • Investigators are looking into the suspect's online activity.
"The videos show a deep-seated rage against his family and society at large."

This case underscores the potential for individuals with radical beliefs to turn to violence and the importance of monitoring and intervening in such situations.

item.title: Elderly woman reduces knee pain naturally with one major dietary change - Watch video - India.com
item.description:
Elderly Woman Eases Knee Pain with Dietary Changes

Publication Date: January 2, 2025
Source: India.com

Knee pain affects many elderly individuals, especially during winter months. An elderly woman shared how she alleviated her pain through dietary changes, specifically increasing her protein intake.

  • Knee pain is a widespread issue among the elderly, often exacerbated in winter.
  • The woman made significant dietary changes by increasing protein consumption.
  • Dr. Sayajirao Gaikwad highlighted the benefits of a rich protein diet, including eggs, paneer, meat, and legumes.
  • She improved her condition significantly, avoiding knee replacement surgery and ensuring better quality of life.
This is how I encourage elderly people to eat high protein foods. With just putting them on high protein foods we see change in quality of their life. Our elder deserve nutrient dense foods. Eggs, paneer, meat, legumes rich diet. Strictly lowering rice, stopping wheat helping her. — Dr. Sayajirao Gaikwad

This case highlights the potential for dietary adjustments to improve health outcomes for elderly individuals, showcasing the importance of nutrition in managing discomfort.

item.title: Norovirus Cases Spike In US, Minnesota Worst Hit - Free Press Journal
item.description:
Norovirus Cases Spike In US, Minnesota Worst Hit

Updated: Thursday, January 02, 2025, 05:15 PM IST

It's now established worldover after coronavirus pandemic that news about public health and public health as a whole, is something to be taken seriously. United States Centers for Disease Control (CDC) has now flagged that norovirus cases have seen a spike in the US. It is not yet known what is causing the spike and the CDC is monitoring the situation.

  • Norovirus outbreaks are typically seen in winter, but this season is seeing a significant increase in cases.
  • On December 5, 2023, the CDC reported 91 cases in just 7 days, a drastic increase compared to previous years.
  • In the years 2020-2024, the highest number of cases recorded in the same time frame was 56.
  • Over 40 of the recent cases have been reported in Minnesota, double the usual count.
“We want to make sure people are aware of this increase in norovirus outbreaks and taking steps to prevent spreading illness to family or friends,” said Jessica Hancock-Allen, the director of the infectious disease division at the Minnesota Department of Health.

This spike in norovirus cases highlights the need for public awareness and preventive measures, especially as the situation develops.

item.title: Take Charge of Your Well-Being in 2025 - News18
item.description:
Take Charge of Your Well-Being in 2025

Date: January 02, 2025 Source: News18

As we step into 2025, it’s vital to prioritize nutrition and fill dietary gaps to support long-term health. Understanding evolving nutritional needs and making informed dietary choices can enhance health and well-being.

  • Nutrition plays a crucial role in long-term health and well-being.
  • Essential nutrients include proteins, omega-3s, vitamins, and minerals.
  • Oral nutritional supplements can help prevent malnutrition.
  • Understanding individual nutritional needs is important across different life stages.
  • Healthy eating patterns lead to overall better health.
“As people become more mindful of their eating habits, the demand for nutrient-dense foods is rising.” - Dr Priti Thakor, Abbott

Focusing on bridging nutritional gaps through food and supplements can lead to a healthier lifestyle in 2025.

item.title: Bhopal gas tragedy: Toxic waste removed from Union carbide factory after 40 years - BBC.com
item.description:
Bhopal gas tragedy: Toxic waste removed from Union carbide factory after 40 years

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: BBC News

Authorities in India have successfully removed hundreds of tonnes of toxic waste from the site of the 1984 Bhopal gas tragedy, where thousands died from a gas leak. The removal follows a court order aimed at addressing the long-standing environmental and health hazards posed by the waste.

  • 337 tonnes of toxic waste transported to an incinerator 230 km away.
  • The waste removal comes 40 years after the gas leak incident that killed thousands.
  • Activists express concern over the health risks of incinerating the waste at the new location.
  • Groundwater near the factory remains contaminated, affecting residential areas.
  • Previous attempts to dispose of the waste faced significant opposition and were abandoned.
  • The Bhopal gas tragedy is recognized as one of the largest industrial disasters globally.
“The 1.1 million tonnes of toxic soil and waste still continues to contaminate the groundwater of hundreds and thousands of people [in Bhopal],” said Rachna Dhingra from the International Campaign for Justice in Bhopal.

The recent waste removal is a critical step but highlights the ongoing challenges related to environmental justice and health for Bhopal’s residents.

item.title: "He Should Tell Virat Kohli...": India Great Blasts Gautam Gambhir's 'Batting' Coaching - NDTV Sports
item.description:
"He Should Tell Virat Kohli...": India Great Blasts Gautam Gambhir's 'Batting' Coaching

Publication Date: December 30, 2024 | Source: NDTV

Indian cricketer Virat Kohli faces difficulties in the ongoing Test series against Australia, raising questions about the effectiveness of head coach Gautam Gambhir's support.

  • Kohli has scored only 167 runs in four matches with an average of 27.83.
  • He has been struggling with deliveries outside the off-stump, leading to many dismissals.
  • A former player criticized Gambhir for not providing adequate guidance to Kohli.
  • Concerns grow regarding team morale and communication under Gambhir's coaching.
  • The Indian team faces challenges in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy against a strong Australian side.
“If he knows what is wrong, he should tell him,” an unnamed former player stated about Gambhir's lack of communication with Kohli.

The article highlights the growing frustrations regarding the coaching staff's handling of star players amid a challenging Test series and raises questions about future performance and team dynamics.

item.title: Vivo announces price cut for T3x 5G smartphone: Check new prices, specs - Business Standard
item.description:
Vivo announces price cut for T3x 5G smartphone: Check new prices, specs

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: Business Standard

The Vivo T3x 5G smartphone has received a price reduction across all variants, making it more accessible to consumers. The smartphone, launched in April last year, offers enhanced specifications for its new lower prices.

New Prices:

  • 4GB RAM + 128GB storage: Rs 12,499 (was Rs 13,499)
  • 6GB RAM + 128GB storage: Rs 13,999 (was Rs 14,999)
  • 8GB RAM + 128GB storage: Rs 15,499 (was Rs 16,499)

Features:

  • Qualcomm Snapdragon 6 Gen 1 chipset
  • 6.72-inch FHD+ resolution display with 120Hz refresh rate
  • 6000mAh battery with 44W fast charging
  • Dual rear camera: 50MP + 2MP, 8MP front camera
“Vivo highlights the inclusion of its RAM 3.0 technology, enabling up to 8GB of virtual RAM for enhanced multitasking.”

This price cut aims to enhance the smartphone's competitiveness in the growing market.

item.title: Take A Look At The Hyundai Creta Electric In These 10 Images - CarDekho
item.description:
Hyundai Creta Electric (Creta EV) Explained In 10 Images

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: CarDekho.com

The Hyundai Creta Electric has been unveiled as the most affordable electric vehicle from Hyundai in India. It retains much of the design language from the regular Creta but includes specific features tailored for EV performance.

  • Redesigned front fascia with a new pixelated pattern replacing the conventional grille.
  • Aerodynamically styled 17-inch alloy wheels.
  • Available with two battery pack options: 42 kWh (Medium Range) and 51.4 kWh (Long Range).
  • ARAI-claimed ranges of 390 km for the medium range and 473 km for the long range.
  • Fast charging capabilities: 10-80% in just 58 minutes with a DC fast charger.
  • Expected starting price of Rs 20 lakh (ex-showroom).
“The Creta Electric can be charged to 100% in approximately 4 hours using an 11 kW AC charger.”

The Creta Electric is set to compete with other electric SUVs such as Tata Curvv EV and Mahindra BE 6, marking a significant entry into the growing electric vehicle market in India.

item.title: Box Office New Year Record: Aamir Khan Dominates Top 10 List, Allu Arjun’s Pushpa 2 Strikes Shah Rukh Khan & Prabhas! - Koimoi
item.description:
Box Office New Year Record: Aamir Khan Dominates Top 10 List, Allu Arjun’s Pushpa 2 Strikes Shah Rukh Khan

Date: January 1, 2025 | Source: Koimoi

Allu Arjun started the new year strongly as Pushpa 2 earned 10 crore INR on its 28th day of release, making it one of the top 10 collections for a Hindi film on January 1.

  • Pushpa 2 makes 10 crore INR on January 1, 2025, ranking 8th in the top 10 first-day January box office collections.
  • Allu Arjun's film surpassed Shah Rukh Khan’s Dunki and Prabhas's Salaar, both of which had a box-office clash on December 21, 2023.
  • Aamir Khan leads the top 10 list with four films, including Dangal, PK, 3 Idiots, and Dhoom 3.
“Pushpa 2 earned 63% more than its predecessor on the same day.”

This new achievement contributes significantly to Allu Arjun's standing in the industry while Aamir Khan continues to dominate the box office rankings.

item.title: Nimisha Priya case in Yemen: ‘We will do whatever we can,’ says highly placed Iranian official - The Hindu
item.description:
Iran to Assist in Case of Indian Nurse Sentenced to Death in Yemen

Date: January 02, 2025 Source: The Hindu

The Iranian government has pledged to assist in the case of Nimisha Priya, an Indian nurse sentenced to death in Yemen for manslaughter. The case highlights the complexities of international relations as India navigates support from Iran amidst multiple factions in Yemen.

  • Iran will advocate for Nimisha Priya, serving as a potential ally for India in the case.
  • The death sentence was confirmed by Yemen's President Rashad Al Alimi, with an execution expected within a month.
  • Priya was convicted of killing her business partner, with a history of alleged abuse in their partnership.
  • The Ministry of External Affairs is exploring options to resolve the case, including the possibility of blood money.
“We will do whatever we can,” said a senior Iranian official regarding assistance for Priya.

The international discourse surrounding this case may influence future diplomatic relations between the countries involved.

item.title: Rohit Sharma dropped for SCG Test vs Australia - The Times of India
item.description:
Rohit Sharma Dropped for SCG Test Against Australia

Date: Friday
Source: Times of India

Rohit Sharma has been dropped from the Indian cricket team for the Sydney Test against Australia due to his poor recent form.

  • Rohit returned to lead the team after missing the first Test due to the birth of his second child.
  • His return saw changes in batting order that did not yield positive results.
  • Rohit has scored only 31 runs in five innings during the ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
  • His overall performance in 2024 has been disappointing, with a meager average of 24.76.
  • Jasprit Bumrah is expected to lead the team in this final match of the series.
“Rohit has mustered just 31 runs from five innings at an average of 6.20.”

This decision marks a significant moment in Rohit Sharma's career, as he appears to be moving towards the end of his Test journey.

item.title: How change in diet eased elderly woman's knee pain; doctor shares heartwarming video - The Times of India
item.description:
How Change in Diet Eased Elderly Woman's Knee Pain

Publication Date: Not provided Source: Not provided

In a heartwarming post, Dr. Sayajirao Gaikwad shares how dietary changes significantly improved an elderly woman's quality of life by alleviating her knee pain.

  • Protein is crucial for the elderly to combat sarcopenia, which leads to muscle loss.
  • The woman in the video, initially advised for knee replacement, experienced a 75% reduction in pain after modifying her diet.
  • Dr. Gaikwad emphasizes incorporating protein-rich foods like eggs, paneer, meat, and legumes while minimizing rice and wheat.
  • Important protein sources include lentils, chickpeas, and dairy products like Greek yogurt.
“With just putting them on high protein foods we see change in quality of their life. Our elder deserve nutrient dense foods.” — Dr. Sayajirao Gaikwad

This article highlights the importance of dietary adjustments for the elderly, showcasing how a focus on protein can lead to substantial health improvements.

item.title: Nitish comes up with cryptic response after Lalu's fresh offer to join INDIA bloc - The Hindu
item.description:
Nitish's Cryptic Response to Lalu's Offer Regarding INDIA Bloc

Published on: January 02, 2025 03:31 pm IST | Source: The Hindu

Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar responded cryptically to RJD president Lalu Prasad's recent offer to join the INDIA bloc. Amidst political speculations, Kumar's dismissive reply has sparked discussions on the future of alliances in Bihar.

  • Nitish Kumar's response to Lalu's offer was simply, "Kya bol rahe hain" (What are you saying).
  • Tejashwi Yadav attempted to downplay Lalu's remarks, suggesting they were aimed at media curiosity.
  • Lalu Prasad stated, "Our doors are open (for Nitish). He should also unbolt his gates."
  • The context of this exchange includes the backdrop of upcoming Assembly polls.
  • Union Minister Rajiv Ranjan Singh asserted the NDA's strength, downplaying Lalu's comments.
“What would he do if people like you keep coming to him with the same question?” - Tejashwi Yadav

This exchange highlights the ongoing political maneuvering in Bihar as parties prepare for future elections, reflecting shifting alliances and public sentiment.

item.title: After Bollywood's biggest dud The Lady Killer, Arjun Kapoor and Bhumi Pednekar reunite for Mere Husband Ki Biwi - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Arjun Kapoor and Bhumi Pednekar Reunite for Mere Husband Ki Biwi

Published on: Jan 02, 2025 by: Devansh Sharma

Actors Arjun Kapoor, Bhumi Pednekar, and Rakul Preet Singh will share the screen in a film titled "Mere Husband Ki Biwi" after their previous collaboration in the poorly received film "The Lady Killer".

  • The upcoming film is set to be released on February 21, 2025.
  • A playful announcement on Instagram describes the film's love story as unique: "Yahaan pyaar ki geometry thodi twisted hai - kyunki ye love triangle nahi, pura circle hai!"
  • The film will be directed by Mudassar Aziz, known for his work on films like "Khel Khel Mein" and "Pati Patni Aur Woh".
  • The film's producers include Vashu Bhagnani, Jackky Bhagnani, and Deepshikha Deshmukh.
  • Arjun and Bhumi's last film, "The Lady Killer," was a commercial failure, earning only ₹60,000 against a budget of ₹45 crore.
“It's lighthearted, relatable, and full of moments that will stay with you long after you leave the theater,” said director Mudassar Aziz.

In summary, the reunion of Arjun Kapoor and Bhumi Pednekar aims to create a better reception from audiences, following their last film's disappointing performance.

item.title: Oversleeping: Too Much Sleep Can Be Bad For Your Health, Heres how - NDTV Doctor
item.description:
Oversleeping: Too Much Sleep Can Be Bad For Your Health, Here's how

Date: Jan 2, 2025 Source: DoctorNDTV

Oversleeping can significantly affect your physical and mental health, increasing risks for serious conditions.

  • Oversleeping is linked to cardiovascular disease, diabetes, and headaches.
  • It can cause mental health issues such as depression and anxiety.
  • Sleeping too much may lead to weight gain by affecting diet and physical activity patterns.
  • The recommended sleep duration for adults is 7-9 hours, depending on individual factors.
  • Seeking professional help is advised if oversleeping is frequent.
“Having enough, quality sleep is crucial for your mental and physical health.”

In summary, while sleep is essential, oversleeping can lead to adverse health effects. Balance and moderation are key for overall well-being.

item.title: Indo Farm Equipment IPO Day 3 Live Updates: Issue subscribed over 199 times so far; check GMP. Apply or not? | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Indo Farm Equipment IPO Day 3 Live Updates: Issue subscribed over 220 times so far; check GMP. Apply or not?

Date: 02 Jan, 2025

Source: LiveMint

The Indo Farm Equipment IPO has captured a significant interest from investors, being heavily oversubscribed with only a day left for bidding. The IPO offers shares at a price band of ₹204 to ₹215.

  • The IPO commenced on December 31 and will conclude on January 2.
  • The company aims to raise ₹260.15 crore from the IPO.
  • As of now, the IPO is subscribed over 220 times.
  • The grey market premium (GMP) for the IPO suggests a potential listing gain of 42%.
  • Prominent financial institutions are recommending to subscribe to the IPO.
"Indo Farm Equipment brings investors an opportunity to invest in a fully integrated and well-researched manufacturer of agricultural and construction equipment."

Investors are urged to consider their long-term investment strategy before deciding on participation in the IPO.

item.title: Rohit Sharma set to be ‘rested’ for Sydney Test, Jasprit Bumrah likely to lead India in BGT finale - The Indian Express
item.description:
Rohit Sharma opts to ‘rest’ for Sydney Test, Jasprit Bumrah to lead India in BGT finale

Published on: Jan 02, 2025 by: The Indian Express

India’s Test captain Rohit Sharma has decided to rest for the final Test of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy against Australia, with Jasprit Bumrah stepping in as captain.

  • Rohit informed coach Gautam Gambhir and chairman of selectors Ajit Agarkar of his decision to opt-out.
  • Shubman Gill will replace Rohit in the playing XI, batting at number three.
  • This may mark Rohit's last Test for India given his struggles and the upcoming World Test Championship cycle.
  • Bumrah aims to level the series 2-2 in this crucial match.
  • Rohit has had a rocky performance lately, averaging 6.2 in his last three Tests.
“Everything is fine with Rohit. We are going to have a look at the wicket and announce the playing XI tomorrow,” - Gautam Gambhir

In conclusion, Rohit's decision raises questions about his future with the team as Bumrah takes charge in a decisive match.

item.title: Manu Bhaker, Gukesh among four athletes to get Khel Ratna award - The Hindu
item.description:
Manu Bhaker, Gukesh among four athletes to get Khel Ratna award

Date: January 02, 2025 Source: The Hindu

The quartet of shooter Manu Bhaker, World Chess Champion D. Gukesh, men's hockey captain Harmanpreet Singh, and para-athlete Praveen Kumar were named recipients of this year's Major Dhyan Chand Khel Ratna Award — the country's highest sporting honour.

  • Manu Bhaker won two medals in the recent Olympics, becoming the first athlete from independent India to achieve this.
  • D. Gukesh became the youngest World Chess Champion and contributed to India's gold in the Chess Olympiad.
  • Harmanpreet Singh led the Indian men's hockey team to a bronze medal in the Olympics.
  • Praveen Kumar was crowned the T64 champion in the Paris Paralympics.
“The awardees will receive their awards from the President of India at a specially organised function at Rashtrapati Bhavan on 17th January, 2025 [Friday] at 1100 hours,” the Sports Ministry said.

This recognition highlights the excellence and achievements of these athletes in their respective sports, showcasing India's emerging sporting talent.

item.title: Stock Market Rally: Why did the Nifty jump 450 points on Thursday? Key factors, contributors explained - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Stock Market Rally: Why did the Nifty jump 450 points on Thursday? Key factors, contributors explained

Date: January 2, 2025 Source: CNBC TV18

The Nifty index experienced its largest single-day gain in six weeks, rising by 450 points on a day characterized by significant market movements and foreign investor positioning.

  • The Nifty gained nearly 500 points during the trading session, closing at 24,168, after hitting an intraday high of 24,226.
  • Key factors include low net longs among Foreign Institutional Investors (FIIs) and the expiry of Nifty options contracts, triggering short-covering.
  • Positive commentary from brokerages like Bernstein encouraged buying in Indian stocks.
“Selectively start buying Indian stocks.” – Bernstein

The rally is expected to influence market sentiment positively, with key contributors such as Infosys and Bajaj Finance showing notable gains.

item.title: ‘They are sending goons and murderers’: Mamata alleges BSF facilitating entry of infiltrators to destabil - The Times of India
item.description:
Mamata Accuses BSF of Aiding Infiltrators in West Bengal

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: [Insert Source Here]

West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee alleged that the Border Security Force (BSF) is facilitating the entry of infiltrators, which she claims is intended to destabilize the state.

  • Mamata claims the BSF is sending "goons and murderers" into West Bengal.
  • She emphasizes the need for strict action against such infiltrations.
  • The allegations come amidst ongoing tensions in the state regarding immigration and border security.
“They are sending goons and murderers,” Mamata alleged.

This accusation points to growing concerns over security in West Bengal and raises questions about the role of central agencies in state governance.

item.title: Realme 14 Pro 5G Series Camera Features Revealed; to Get 50-Megapixel Telephoto Sensor - Gadgets 360
item.description:
Realme 14 Pro 5G Series Camera Features Revealed Ahead of India Launch

Publication Date: January 2023 Source: Gadgets 360

The Realme 14 Pro 5G series is set to launch in India, with exciting camera features including a 50-megapixel triple rear camera and advanced AI imaging tools.

  • The series will include Realme 14 Pro 5G and Realme 14 Pro+ 5G models.
  • Camera setup features a 50-megapixel Sony IMX896 primary sensor, alongside an 8-megapixel ultrawide shooter.
  • Includes a telephoto lens supporting up to 3x optical zoom.
  • Supports multiple imaging modes like AI Ultra Clarity 2.0 and AI HyperRAW Algorithm.
  • Equipped with a Snapdragon 7s Gen 3 chipset and 6,000mAh battery.
“The camera setup will include optical image stabilization and advanced HDR processing to improve clarity and brightness.”

The launch of the Realme 14 Pro 5G series is generating significant interest due to its advanced camera technologies and design features.

item.title: Vodafone Idea 5G Launch in 2025? Time to BUY Vi stock - Target price - ET Now
item.description:
Vodafone Idea Plans 5G Launch by March 2025 – Stock Target at Rs 13

Updated: January 2, 2025 14:46 IST

Vodafone Idea (Vi) is set to launch its 5G mobile broadband service by March 2025, targeting high-demand areas to compete with rivals Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel.

  • 5G will be rolled out in 75 cities across 17 priority circles.
  • Plans may be up to 15% cheaper than competitors, potentially igniting a price war.
  • The company aims to enhance its 4G coverage alongside the launch of 5G.
  • CEO Akshaya Moondra indicated final pricing would be decided closer to launch.
  • Vodafone Idea recently secured Rs 24,000 crore in equity funding.
  • They plan to deploy 75,000 5G sites over the next three years.
  • Citi maintains a 'Buy/High Risk' rating, projecting a target price of Rs 13 per share.
“Clarity on debt funding will be a key catalyst for the stock's performance going ahead.”

As Vodafone Idea prepares for its ambitious expansion into 5G, the telecom market may witness significant shifts in competitive strategies and pricing.
